patterns: Do you have any advice on how to stop bullying?
I can't take being bullied anymore.
I hate it when someone is bullying me.
Out of nowhere he/she is bullying me.
responses: You might want to talk about it to your parents or your teacher as soon as possible.
Seek counseling, especially to someone you trust the most.
If you feel unsafe, always find help.
Try to be calm and tell him/her to stop in still, clear voice. Brush it off with humor. This works best if joking is easy for you. It could catch the kid bullying you off guard.
Speak up, but if speaking up seems too hard or not safe, walk away and stay away. Don't fight back.
Assert yourself. Tell the bullies that what they've been doing isn't funny and has been hurting you in firm and collected manner. Then kindly warn them not to do it again.

patterns: What should I do if I had an argument with someone?
I got into an argument with someone
Me and my friend had an argument
responses: You should calm down first and take a time out. People can't think clearly when they're highly emotional. And once you've cool off, talk to him/her again.
First thing you need to do is took a deep breath and try to apologize to him/her if you're ready to talk again. Explain your side in a calm manner.
Cool off for the time being to avoid further conflicts.
Be conscious of your own emotional reaction and give yourself time to think and feel before talking.
Consider expressing your feelings. It's essential that you don't blame someone for your feelings. Instead, explain what is bothering you about the situation.

I may not experiencing what you are feeling right now but you you didn't deserve that, and you deserve support now.

patterns: I'm having a hard time to fit in my new job and I feel anxious

responses: Spend as much time as possible preparing for your new work to help ease tension and anxiety and increase your confidence.
Discuss your feelings with someone you trust about your new job nerves and any worries about it to help calm your anxiety.
Ask questions with your peers especially on your first day, in order for you to learn as much as possible about your new job, coworkers, management, and the company.
